review: Friday's is an old stand-by. I prefer their drinks over their food. Got a yummy Pomegranate Ultimate Margarita for $5, so wasn't too upset that my BBQ Chicken Wrap was lacking in flavor and freshness. Fries were decent but nothing stood out.  For some reason, the staff always seems nicer to one another than to the guests. They're always laughing and joking, which makes me wonder why can't I get some of that love? Just sayin'.... We decided to go here than stick with Applebee's next door. Next time, we're going to Applebee's.
Im a big fan! I go there alot. If you want good service no ask for waitress Jazz.

It is a chain restaurant.  The food is alright.- nothing great, nothing special.  I pretty much only go there if I have a coupon.   I don't think the manager was doing their job.  I was there for an hour 2 nights ago and the womens bathroom had no toilet paper for the entire hour that I was there even though I told staff that there was no TP after a few minutes of arriving.   The waitress seemed bored and apathetic.  The hostess was very sweet and kind.  The food was meh.

Friday's is a place that has not adjusted to other bars in the area, and whose indifferent staff just doesn't cross the finish line.   Food - Pub food, burgers and a few specialty dishes.  Example:  The Korean tacos?  Clearly designed by Kim Jong Un with the hidden 'where's the beef' meat.  Best value is probably the unlimited soup and salad. Service - I used to frequent the bar, where previously, veteran talent and service made the difference.  Alas, the vets are gone, and their replacements are sadly not up to speed.  Example:  I waited 25 minutes in a nearly empty (4 other bar patrons) for a burger, and further watched the blonde bartender chat up some other patrons in lieu of serving customers. Location:  Good, right off of 95.  Protip:  Try not to fuel up at the world's most expensive Exxon up the street, and if hitting HH, be mindful of the county's finest trolling to waylay you after a sip or two.. Other:  Good HH times.  Fridays and Saturday nights, mind the thumping at the bar as the quasi hip-hop DJing begins.  Mianly younger crowd. If you are looking for chain pub fare, there's the Greene Turtle (younger), Applebee's (yuck, not my style), Frisco Burrito (good beer selection, but expensive), and Victoria's up the street (slightly older crowd, little more expensive).
Dingy. Sticky. Dark. Dirty. Bathroom like flashes of the acopalyse. Just bring company with you. Can't handle a large crowd-- service pathetic.

Never order food to go. I truly believe they recycle left overs from other customers plates. Ordered bone in buffalo wings and they had a combination of boneless and some with other sauces that I did not order. Which is utterly disgusting!!! I will never patronize this restaurant again.  Another dump that needs to be shut down by the health department.

Went here Friday night after work with the family.  Service was decent and the food was ok.  It is your average chain sit down place.  Nothing special to make it stand out but not the worst place to go get food.

If Robert Irvine and the Restaurant Impossible crew visited chain restaurants, this place would be a prime candidate.  It's obvious the management is severely lacking.  A feedback session filled with verbal thrashings in a British accent may be exactly what this place needs.  The food is decent, but the service is just horrendous.  It should never take 30 minutes to bring a kid's drink at 3:30PM when the place is dead.  I know the deal, the bartender makes certain kids drinks.  Seeing staff members (to include the manager) walk in from an obvious extended smoke break while our appetizers arrive without the kids meal or drinks really set me off.  I wanted to get up and leave but the wife needed her Korean steak taco fix (which were skimpy on the steak).  She's also had poor experiences with the to-go service facing long waits during off peak hours.  It seems like the kitchen has it together, but the front is...how should I put this...WACK!  Bottomline, it would take a serious coupon to get me to visit here ever again.
Service sucks. The food is horrible and the waitress are jerks. They also have flies....disgusting!!
Great place for Happy hour. Bartender very friendly and tje prices of appetizers and drinks are great!

Service was very slow. Waitress didn't seem to care. $18.99 ribs were dry, almost hard. Definitely not "fall off the bone". My wife's broccoli had been so over cooked that it tasted horrible. Neither of us could eat it. My wife had the "Pick 2 for $12", but we were charged for each item separately. I didn't realize it until I got home and studied the receipt closer. The entire family returned home with stomach problems. Yuk!

Decided to go to TGIFridays.   Got seated right away.  Not really crowded.  Waited something like 7 or 8 minutes before a server came to take drink orders.  As he took my order, he suggested we order dinner because he was "running all over the place tonight."  We were ready so we did. After ordering we asked him to bring us utensils.  He came back about 12 minutes later and said he would bring us drink refills.  We said thanks and could he bring us utensils. Food came out about 15 minutes after that.  We asked for utensils and he said "Oh.  Sure."  5 minutes later no refills, no utensils.  Sean gets up and wanders around the restaurant picking up rolled utensils pcks from empty tables.  He got 3 and said his ribs/shrimp could be finger food. another 5 minutes and our server is checking on the table behind us.  I get his attention and ask for refills.  He says "OH...sure."  Then looks and says "Do you need utensils?"  We say no we wandered the restaurant and got our own. Another 5 minutes and finally refills. Son had debated about a dinner and decided to go with ribs and shrimp.  His plan was that some of the ribs would be leftover for another meal.   He is eating and says "Mom, is this normal?"  Peels of a sheet of something from the bottom of the ribs.  We look at it and are pretty sure it is plastic.  He said he had pulled some off the others but decided to look at the bottom before he went further.  We call the server over, tell him and he says he will get the manager.  (He has to wait as the manager is talking to another table who are complaining about the service). Manager comes over, sticks his fingers in the ribs and starts explaining to us that the ribs come frozen.  Probably the plastic stuck to frozen ribs.  He asks Son if he wants more ribs - Son laughs and says No.  He did offer a dessert but we declined. He takes Son's plate and leaves with the sheet of plastic (about the size of half a sheet of paper). We don't see him again.  Server comes over with our check.  He says "Did someone come over and help you?"  I said we spoke briefly to the manager.  he says "Yeah he says you are all wrong  it isn't plastic...its fat."  Fat that didn't melt down when ribs were cooked?  Or ribs cooked so long ago the fat solidified like a sheet of plastic?  I said "we disagree but thanks." The check did remove my son's dinner cost - but no apology or anything.  We are upset and nervous about the potential that my son has consumed some of this plastic.  A truly bad experience with potential health hazards. Forgot to mention that as we arrived, the couple leaving said "Run for your lives - it isn't worth it."
We had our Christmas party n the manger put us out cause they say we too loud. But it's Happy Hour.Really never again
Worst Tgi Friday's ever.  No busboy.  The hostess is hardly at the front.  When we finally sat down no waitresses came by.  We just asked the hostess to do take out.  EWW worst experience ever.
Not a fan - never have been. The food isn't great and the service is always subpar. The only good thing is that they can accommodate large groups of people.

Mid afternoon lunch on New Years Day. Maybe a dozen or so tables occupied. Wife ordered the California Club. I ordered the Cajun Shrimp and Chicken pasta - please hold the peppers. All went downhill from there. Drinks came - no straws. Had to ask hostess for them. Opened our silverware - my knife looked as if it had bird poo on it (see photo). How could that be missed? Appetizer arrived. Server vanished before we could ask for another knife as well as small plates. Entrees arrived. My pasta was loaded with the peppers. It also had shrimp tails/empty shells mixed in - you know, the part that is supposed to be discarded. Waitress apologized, then proceeded to tell me that the shrimp do have tails in that dish. Wow...... That has been my go to dish here, and I've NEVER found JUST the tail shells and tails in there before.  Just overall a very disappointing experience. This makes two in a row - we will probably be phasing out this particular location.

Have not eaten here for a while.  The music is too loud.  I feel like I am at the bar. Service is slow. Had to get waitress attention twice.  Took her time getting to us. Forgot our wings. The place is packed but everyone is enjoying themselves.  I ordered the ribs. They were Ok I have had better.  After finishing the ribs I was still hungry.  Boy I wish I had those wings I ordered 20 minutes ago.   The fries here is average. The cold slaw tasted like it was old.  Overall view nothing special here. Move along.

Let me start by saying.... RIDICULOUS! Let me next say our waiter was fabulous. The front end greeters were horrible. I know there is a so called science to seating diners and managing a dining room, but Really?? We arrived - a party of 6, on a Saturday evening (630pm) expecting a wait. When got inside we realized the dining room was maybe half full.  We were greeted and told that we would have a 35 to 40 minute wait.  After waiting 45 minutes we asked the hostess how much longer we could expect to be waiting and if it was possible to be seated at a table that had been empty since we arrived.  She kind of looked at us but said she had one more group of 8 ahead of us. Not sure where this group was but we said "OK". We did realize there were a lot of parties of 2 who were not being seated and there were 4 table for 2 in a row empty. Finally half of us sat down at the table close to the door that had been empty for the last hour. We then asked is it possible to get this table since you have seated the party of 8. They said yes, give them a minute. Not sure at that point what we were waiting for but we said "OK". Finally we all sat down and asked passing waitresses for menus.  She said yes retrieved menus and brought them to us.  Finally, we can eat. We were all relieved. Mind you it has now been 1hour and 20 minutes. RIDICULOUS. They were not even crowded. Now we know why, they were not crowded. Our waiter came over offered us drinks and/or water. MIKE was his name. Very low key quiet guy but Great. And the drinks were great.  That's the best I can say. Our food was awful. it was cold. My burger was dry and stiff as if it had been sitting for hours. My friends food was Luke warm and she just said whatever at that point. My other girlfriend got the Jack Daniels sampler only for that to look like they just thrown it on the plate. I forgot to mention after waiting a hour and 20 minutes to get seated we waited 45 minutes for burgers and pasta. Kill me already. Our waiter went to check on our food multiple times. Did I mention the drinks were good.  After we had had enough and I was at my wits end, I asked to speak with a manager- Ed the assistant manager came over. I proceeded to tell him how unhappy we were with our food, he cut me off and said "Hold up you need to speak with the Kitchen Manager - Senior Manager (as he put it). I thought that was rude, condescending and unacceptable. I just said "OK". He comes back about 4 minutes later only to say that the manager said he is to busy to speak with us. He does not have time. We were told to call 1-800-FRIDAYS.  RIDICULOUS.  I was shocked. I am not usually left speechless but I was. I was dumbfounded. But what did we expect  from the beginning. Customer service was lacking.  i take blame for staying in the situation as long as I did . We should have left after the 45 minute wait when the dining room was not even full. But REALLY a manger who says he is too busy to talk to a customer. If he was too busy because he was doing the cooking, then ED the assistant manager who went to get MARTY this so called Senior Manager should have said that. Also , if MARTY (Senior Manager) is doing the cooking, please take him off the grill. Our food was not  good. I say worse then substandard. How hard is it to cook FRIDAYS food. We are not talking 5 star dining. I do expect decent customer service. I will never go to this location again.

The food service was a bit slow but overall the food was great. We were a party of 4 on a Saturday night so that can be expected. I did like the fact that the server still checked back on us even though the food took a little time to come out.  Great food and Great service!!
We had good attentive service. Our food was okay and arrived timely.  But when it comes to interior set up, it comes down hill with the newly renovated Arundel Mills location.

We went to get some dinner (around 7). We got our beers when seated at the bar and ordered... The place was packed but other people seemed to be getting food - eventually. They were clearly understaffed on the floor and there were about 5 people behind the bar. We waited an HOUR AND A HALF for just the appetizers; no one came to check on us. We watched people in the restaurant area (3) get served their entire meal before we even got an appetizer. The appetizer was soggy and uncooked and they FORGOT the other one! We basically just said forget it, and asked to speak to the manager. He didn't come over to us (from the register because the waitress/bartenders had screwed it up) for at least 20 minutes. "Would you eat this?" We refused to pay and just left. HORRIBLE wait staff and I'd tell you about the food quality (even though it's just a Friday's) but I wouldn't know because I never received mine.

My biggest problem with this place is it smells like they used a sour mop to clean the place. We just went tonight and the smell permeated the place. I did not notice it at first until my lady pointed it out to me. The food is acceptable, but why go back there when it smells like a garbage truck in 90 degree weather. In addition, the hospitality and customer service needs work here, as after requesting to be moved to a different table, the server/ hostess gave us a bit of an attitude. Never going back here.
Turkey burger is my favorite... but this is your basic chain food restaurant.

Worst service ever the guy Michael ignored us after taking our order. When the food can out my friend didn't get the honey mustard that was suppose come with the burger. The silverware was dirty and we asked for a new set that came and the new set had food still stuck to it. All around bad experience I won't be eating at this location ever again.
The server was awful and the silverware was dirty my overall experiance was terrible.

The food is consistently awful at this location. The icing on the cake was today when I called in an order. Being ill today I really wanted an offer of sesame Jack chicken strips and a wedge salad my boyfriend ordered cajun shrimp and chicken pasta. I picked it up, paid full price and went home only to realize half the order was missing. Dumb on my part I know, but I'm out of it and sick. The food we do have is either greasy or dry.  I called and asked to speak to a manager. She was ok but non empathetic. TL;DR Don't eat at this shit hole. Go to the Fridays in hanover md much better.

I'm so pleased with this location I had a bad experience at the location in Owings mills but this one in Colombia was on point. Nice friendly waitress I highly recommend for a great dining experience.

This is one of the worst Fridays I have visited. First, we arrived at lunch.  There were only a couple of tables occupied, but no host/hostess in site.  After standing there for a solid five minutes, someone came out to seat us. The service was sub-par and the food unremarkable.  Besides that, the restaurant itself was dirty and dingy.  The booth cushions were ripped and stained.  I think this place needs a serious overhaul.   By the time we left, the place still only had maybe 4 tables occupied, on a nice day, during lunch hour.  That tells me something.
Pretty cool for happy hour (Tues-Thurs).  Main menu did not appeal to me but I had a coupon.

Needs better management. Floor filthy, poor service. Needed to go to kitchen door to pay check, since server disappeared. Oh wait, he was too busy carrying on a conversation with a coworker and ignoring our waves. Ridiculous experience.

Great service at the bar.  I ordered the jack Daniels steak.  And the bartender recommended the upgrade from the flat iron to the rib eye.  Everything came out quick and hott. I'm typically leary about ordering steaks at chain restaurants, due to ordering most steaks medium rare.  It came out perfect. I ordered 2 margaritas they were decent. I will definitely go back.

Food was good but the server was a little overwhelmed she kept bringing the wrong food to the table and not checking back on us. I t wasn't very crowded on a Saturday night which is shocking. The unlimited appetizers for 10.00 we're perfect and the beer was the coldest I've had thus far. I will give another shot because Fridays is 1 of my favorites.

I am not a big  fan of their food. However, my server was the most respectful, professional individual I have had in a long time. He was able to work a big group by giving us the upmost service. He was a constant. We didn't have to hunt him down. He was awesome.

At this particular location the food is usually good. The issue comes with the staffing. It always takes a long time get waited on in this Fridays. I'm not sure if it's a payroll issue or if they just can't keep staff. There was no host at the door and someone had to go fetch him. He came speeding back up but not without words to his Co worker about only being one person.  The plus to all of this is that the waiters and waitresses are very polite. It seems like they understand their flaws and they are very apologetic.  I'm sitting in the restaurant right now and it's not busy on a Saturday evening. It feels weird.

It was unfortunately understaffed and it took my group of 5 a long time to be sat and it took over 20 minutes to order. The food was average and bar food, considering we all got endless appetizers.  The time in between orders took a while too. None the less, the service was slow but considerate given the situation. The bathroom was pretty gross though, I'll spare the details.

I solicited my girlfriend for comments to add to this review but she was too busy grabbing a few more of the jack Daniel's sesame chicken wings (which I think is an endirsement). Serine was pretty attentive for a change and all food was hot. I gotta go, she's digging into the celery sticks.

This is by far the WORST location!   We went here over the weekend.  It was maybe our 3rd time going here--how quickly I remembered why we avoided this place.  There is never a hostess at the front.  Once the hostess came back, she infromed us she would see if there were any tables available; otherwise we could sit at the bar.  This would be completely understandable IF the restaurant was packed.  However, we were standing directly infront where there were atleast 15 free tables all along the center of the restaurant and  the right side by the windows.   We did not want to sit at the bar and the hostess said, she'd check again if there were available tables; otherwise we'd have to sit at the bar.  She did not even offer for us to WAIT for a table.  Luckily, a table became available.  We sat, looked at the menu and decided what we wanted in about 10 minutes.  In that time, no waiter stopped by to even ask our drink order.  In fact, we NEVER met our waiter.  We waited a good 20 minutes for NOTHING, then got up and left.     **TIP TO ALL**: Save your time and headache and do yourself a favor and GO TO THE ONE AT ARUNDEL MILLS!  We drove there and recieved superb service!

Well, this was the first time that I have been here.  First of all the server had no knowledge of the menu, I asked her if something was fried and she said "No, not at all" and clearly when it came out to the table it was.  On top of that, we had just received our appetizer and she immediately brought out our dinner.  We were not even finished with our meals and she came over and said "Are you guys going to just hang out here or are you ready for the check?"  She did not wait until we were finished our meals, nor did she offer dessert.  I am sorry but I am in the hospitality industry and have been for a long time and that is not how you serve people!  I will never go back there!

Fridays used to be our go to place, but no more. The food is ok or less. Actually the biggest issue is that it is never hot. It used to be at this location 7 days a week you had to wait for a table. Now its always half empty. we try it every few months and are always ok with taste, not great, for most of it. But it comes out luke warm. keeps doing that. Our servers have been sweet and attentive, but the food is not hot. we should send it back but fear it being over cooked. soup should be steaming so you have to blow on it instead of being able to eat it fast. moz sticks should take some getting used to. wings shojld be hot (temperature). none of these things have happened in the last year. again, another place we may not go back to -along with what seems to be a lot of columbia. most places have lines, not here. for a reason. its a shame.

This place was priced like an upscale place which it is not in anyway shape or form. Service was absolutely horrible.  Apps arrived with no silverware, no napkins, no small plates.  Burgers arrived raw after being ordered medium well.  The buns were so soaked with bloody juice they were falling apart.  Had to argue with the server to get them fixed.   We should have known better, we only went there because all the other places in Columbia were packed.  This place was so barren, we honestly thought they were closed or in the process of closing.  My bet is that they will and should be closing for good sometime soon.

I was really shocked at the service we got. The man who served us was really busy which I understood. But the worse you treat me the more you are hurting your own pockets. The food was cold. Had to take back an order cause it tasted like pure butter. My friends burger was not good. I would not come back here

I have ordered to go 3 times. Every time there is something wrong with my order. They either take an additional 30 minutes from the time they say my order was ready or it has been missing something or BOTH. Dining in is much worse. The seats in the bar area are ripped up and the servers are RUDE. I WOULD NEVER recommend this location.

Since Friday's has a mojito, martini, and Long Island ice tea deal on Thursdays I decided to go and check it out. Our waiter was very friendly and made the beverages quickly. I ordered the Jack Daniels Chicken and Shrimp with French fries and spinach. The shrimp was okay the Jack Daniels sauce definitely made it more flavorful however, the grilled chicken was very dry and not as flavorful even with the addition of Jack Daniels sauce. The French fries were just regular French fries while the spinach was pretty tasty. All in all; I gave it three stars because of the okay chicken.
So let me understand this-we are having 15 people tonight to celebrate a graduation so we're spending about $400 but you can't hold a graduation cake for me when it's 85 degrees outside.  Got it

That moment when your neighbor says "Sorry about that awful, awful experience." as you're about to exit the car and trudge the last few steps to the culinary refuge that is your home - that was this afternoon's lunch experience. We arrived at 12:15pm on a Monday afternoon. There were three adults in our party and a reasonably adorable 7 month old girl who was not going to perusing the menu.  There were about 6 other parties seated in the restaurant. After 7 minutes or so, a server approached us. He took our order and then the nightmare spiral began. This was easily the worst dining experience I've had out in the past three years. Now, to be honest, the following is all the whiny bitching of a comfortably well off person. But if you're considering going here - be warned. The following rant should be read in the tone of the guy at the gas station who warns the carload of partying teenagers NOT TO GO TO THE OLD WITHERS' PLACE!!!  My friends ordered an appetizer - it took 30 minutes for the appetizer to show up. As it was a relatively hot and humid day in Maryland where being outside is the rough equivalent of being on the roof of a panting dog's mouth, our drinks were already either going or gone. It took another 35 minutes for the entrees to show up. At some point in between sad emoticon 1 and sad emoticon 2, the server noticed that our drinks were flatlined and said he'd get us refills. Sadly, that was not to be.  Now, a moment here for those of you who don't have the experience of dining with even the most likable of infants - your meal is literally a race against time before the smiling cherub next to you turns into a Game of Thrones tyrant. If we'd been able to eat and roll, this review wouldn't ever see the light of day. But our time there to grab a quick lunch ran to two hours, with us reduced to gulping down the soggy ice cubes so that dehydration didn't claim us whilst trying desperately to keep our youngest member appeased. After we were done, it was another 15 minutes before we even saw our server. To be fair, at some point the number of other parties went up as high as 10 tables, but it looked like only one server was handling the entire dining room area. Never saw a manager, or you can believe that I would have said something, as one member of our group had to work an evening shift and wanted to grab a quick meal and nap before her 4pm shift.  The food was fine, although why it'd take a minimally occupied kitchen an hour to crank out two burgers and a chicken strip meal is not something I can explain. In short - TURN BACK!!! THERE'S STILL TIME TO GO SOMEWHERE, ANYWHERE ELSE!!!

Was pretty good svc for a Wed night.  There was no hostess when we walked in and we stood there awkwardly for 5 min. Had to flag down a waitress to be seated.  Other then that our waiter was great and the food was good.

run away.  run away fast.  tough to get seated..and i HATE begging someone to take my money.  No silverware on table.  Appetizers came out WITH meal...even thought we asked for them first.  Meal was cold.  Drinks were not refilled.  Still no silverware...had to get up and find some ourselves.  Server was MIA most of time.  Had to ask bartender to find someone to give us a check.  Bartender gave us soda refills while we waited (PS...bartender got a tip!) Run away.

Hard pass. Sunday night and essentially empty upon arrival. Seated immediately took our server a while to find us as we were placed directly next to his other two tables. Ordered endless motz sticks ans pot stickers and free coupon sliders. Motz came out drinks came out. Realized we lacked any cutlery or plates so asked our server for some. Luckily on round two and half of our endless aps we got plates and cutlery. Our waiter dissapeared for a while but luckily we were entertained by a dinner show of another waiter dropping an entire tray of drinks all over himself and the floor while the bo jack horseman hostess watched and then proceeding to continue to stare at the mass flood on the floor of drinks and ice. Waiter arrived with more aps yay then we proceeded to eat and ponder what bo jack was contemplating as she was so deep in thought(or lack there of) as there was now a small crowd of ppl standing in front of her waiting ever so patiently for her to acknowledge them while stepping lightly to avoid the spreading tsunami of beverage and ice tickling their toes. Overall waiter was nice for the five total minutes of interaction, bo jack startled the sticka outta me by suddenly springing to life for the first time since our arrival as we were leaving to ensure we have a great night.  Suggest going to mcdonalds....or exxon...for an equal amount of service without the riak of drowning.

I'm giving this 3 stars because the food was really good.  That's about as far as that goes. I went out with my boyfriend and roommate. It was a special occasion and we rarely go out and eat good.  The waiter basically ignored us. My boyfriend was dehydrated from working at the tire shop all day and needed lots of fluids. The waiter did not come by once to ask if he needed a refill. Then he reported that the bathroom was disgusting. These casual dining places really need to do better. Come on really. They weren't even crowded.

Today is my husband's birthday.  We were scheduled to go to another restaurant in the area where we were poorly treated so we left and found this TGI Friday's on Benson Road, Columbia. As soon as we walked through the door the greeter smiled warmly and escorted us to our table.  It wasn't long before our friendly server, Mike, arrived.  He kidded with us and took our drink orders leaving us to mull over the menu choices.  Ed's celebratory Long Island ice tea happy juice and my New Belgium Brewing Fat Tire Ale arrived.  Then Mike took our dinner orders.   Ed loved his Bruschetta Chicken Pasta, the salad was a standard garden salad that was nothing to write home about.  I had a medium-rare 6 ounce sirloin cooked to perfection, steamed broccoli and tomato mozzarella salad.  Yummy!!  Ed got his Tennessee Whiskey cake for dessert and I had the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake.   Our meal was wonderful.  Our server checked on us from time to time not too much and not too little.  So did the manager.  Everyone was friendly, good humored and helpful.  You can't get better than that.  We recommend this TGI Friday's on Benson Road.  We will be coming back.  Thanks for a great time and a happy birthday.

Extremely shocked how the level of service has gone down at this location. I waited to write my review to assure the one time I went and it was horrible just wasn't "a bad night". The service has consecutively been horrible. Each time we were seated immediately as the dining room was less than half full. However after being seated on our last visit it took 45 minutes to even get a server to bring us water ! While waiting my 5 year old needed To use the restroom, boy was this the icing on the cake. The restroom was FILTHY!!! My daughter refused to use it and honestly I'm glad she vowed to hold it because I didn't want to step any further into it. The floor was wet, the smell was unbearable and there was toilet paper on the floor. We returned to the table, alerted the server that finally came we will not be dining here based on how trifling the bathroom was and left. We haven't returned and don't plan on ever returning to this location. We are still so very shocked, years ago this was our favorite Friday's to go to!

This chain overall has gone downhill. We ate here last Sunday evening at it was clear from the beginning they were understaffed. The place was 2/3rds empty and they were struggling to keep up. We ordered the all you can eat appetizers again. They are ok overall, but you can taste the freezer burn on the potato skins. It would be nice if they had some healthier options for appetizers. Also, why not have TVs in the dining area so you can watch football?  After a slow start, the service was pretty good. Our waitress was friendly and helpful. I'm not sure we'll be back. It certainly was a huge improvement over our experience earlier this year at the Towson location (see my earlier write-up).

Had twenty tables open but a 25 minutes wait because the kitchen was in the weeds at 652p on Thursday.  The excuse was we would wait at our table if we were seated.  Stupid concept.  So we left and went to Olive Garden instead.  We will not be back

I'm pushing 60 and look 70, but the bartender insisted I show him my ID saying it was TGIFriday policy.  When I asked why, "Jason" said it was to police for any alcohol restrictions that might show up on a driver's license.  I complied, but now wish I'd have walked out in protest.  I will never go back to any TGIFridays or any other place so condescending and insulting to adults -- especially when there are many other options for mature adults to be treated respectfully.

Second time here in a month, both times took over 15 mins before someone acknowledged we were waiting to be seated. Bar was completely packed with only 5 tables occupied in the dinner side. We were informed all specials for $3 drinks and $5 apps were only for the bar. Left without eating or drinking and will not be back, pretty sure I can get better service at McDonald's

Gotta go for lunch hours during the week. Bartender Ben gives amazing service. Personable and makes you feel like you're walking into a corner bar. He even performs some bar flair regularly!! Great quick lunch spot with great service and food! Jack Daniels burger is the best!

I love Friday's but my recent experience there was not so pleasant due to our waitress, Jereen. I had received coupons in the mail and my 2 friends and I decided to go there and enjoy a nice girls session. We usually order the pick 2 meals in which we all usually get spinach dip and cajun shrimp pasta because that is our favorite meal duos. Upon entering we found out that they no longer do these or the $10 endless appetizers, no biggie we ordered the same regular items off the new menus in which they give smaller portions but for a cheaper amount which is really good to help portion meals and reduce issues such as obesity. This was actually ideal for us all because we were embracing a healthier lifestyle. When paying for our orders we asked if we can use the coupon and our waitress, Jereen, stated she could check but doesn't believe it would work and if it did she would have to individually write out receipts (which seemed odd to me because I have used coupons here before and never had that issue). We recognized that one of the coupons would work and qualified due to us paying regular price for one of the appetizers and Jereen did not seem as if she had any interest in reprinting receipts with new prices or asking a manager if it could be done as she had an obvious attitude. After collecting our credit cards she had asked us if we would also like "To-Go Cups for your waters"...at this point we all realized this was a smart remark as we said "no thank you" she smirked and said "okay have a great year god bless" and walked away. Our waters were fully empty and she never bothered to give us a refill which is another trigger to us that she was purposely being rude. This was EXTREMELY rude. Has this chain went that downhill to the point that their waiters/waitresses feel they can disrespect the people that come into their facilities? I do not have the energy to even express the frustration I have with this chain but if any management views this post please feel free to investigate 1/14/2016, Server Jereen, Table: 60/1, and check 3577.

Horrible place, I will never patronize AGAIN!! Tried this Friday's because it was close to were we had celebrated my daughters' birthdays that day. Entered this restaurant with a group of 15 people and asked to be seated. The hostess informed us it would be 15 mins before we could be seated. I didn't understand why seeing as though it was a slow night & there was a total of 7 other customers in the restaurant but we waited patiently for 20 mins. After 20 mins and walking through the restaurant to the bathroom and noticing there was no setup for my party as of yet, I questioned the hostess to see what the hold up was. She proceeded to inform me that seating wasn't the issue, that my party was waiting for two employees to arrive to work in order for us to be seated. Never in my life have I had to wait for employees to come to work in order for a business to run!! In fact, we had patronized a local IHOP that morning with the same amount of people and they had no problem serving us with the staff they already had on staff!! I waited 15 minutes for a manager who never came before I left. Maybe he was one of the two employees who haven't gotten to work that day!! We drove to the Friday's in Arundel Mills and was seated within 10 mins, serviced by one waiter and tip him very well for accommodating our group.
Terrible service. Took over 2 hours to get our food. The service was really slow and it made us hungrier but it didn't satisfy our expectations
Strange place and clientele.  Pretty slow to be seated or acknowledged.  Lots of families with children past 10 pm.

It's so sad to give them such a terrible rating because the food was actually good. Not like mad gourmet or anything, but good for a chain restaurant. It's also a good value. They have all sorts of deals and varied portions. This could have totally been a regular dining option for us considering the limited options around here. But, But none of that could save this experience.  Service was horrendous.  We were there for 2 hours. 1.5 of those were spent waiting. Waiting for waitress acknowledge us, to take orders, to bring out food, to bring out silverware, to clear table etc....  It was especially painful cause we had a fussy infant & an impatient toddler. She clearly saw us trying to keep it together but it didn't change the pace.  Why does it take 15 mins to bring out an ice cream? Inexcusable dude. Lots of other folks were frustrated too. A couple eventually gave up & walked out after waiting so long.  It's also super dark in there & the tables on the sides are super close together. We kept bumping into the chairs behind us. Unless you have a couple of hours to spare & want to cozy up to some strangers, skip this.

Just visited this Friday's for lunch earlier today and while the waitress was kind I am so disappointed that when I told her my chicken was not cooked all the way (there was pink and it was very rubbery) she returned with it stating the Cook says that's how they cook it and it would still be the same if he put it back on the grill. She offered to let me have the plate back or order something else. I opted for skipping lunch. I order the same meal every single time I go to Friday's and I've been to the one in Columbia plenty of times so I have a good idea of what their cooked chicken looks and tastes like. I won't be back.

Came here with the family for lunch. Haven't been in a while and the new menu was good. Since it was Friday and during Lent, l went for the fried shrimp platter with fries,  but first started out with the french onion soup. It came out hot with a mound of gooey cheese on top. I had to take small pieces of the cheese to eat so my fam didn't have to perform the Heimlich on me. I know it was full of sodium because l could feel my pressure rising with each spoonful of that glorious oniony broth, but since l don't eat this sort of stuff on the regular, l was ok. The shrimp were hot and covered in a light batter with just the right crunch with no grease and so were the fries. I was treated to a martini that came out with a fluff of cotton candy in the glass that the server poured the drink over from a shaker and it was a tasty pink treat! The server, Chris, was great, and the rest of my crew were pleased with their meals as well. Kudos Friday's!

The one thing that keeps me coming back to Friday's is the jack daniels sauce I think the sauce makes everything better especially the burger. I must say when I was there my  server was very good and the food came out fast so as long as they keep the jack daniels sauce I think I'll be a happy customer.

I just moved here about 3 weeks ago, the closest thing to friends I have made are the people here, they are very caring and attentive, shout out goes to the bartenders, they know what they are doing, thank you ALL!

I am a fan of TGI Friday's. The have a varied menu that suits my tastes, and currently make my favorite burgers from this class of family restaurant.  This location is nice and cozy, but I can't really recommend it for a quick lunch. The food came out hot and fresh, and was very delicious. The service though was quite slow and inefficient, even though they were friendly. I'd like to go back when I'm in the area on business, but not sure I can make my lunch break on time.

Good place to go with friends, service is mostly good, the bad servers never seem to stay very long. My favorite dish is the Bourbon Barrel Chicken with tomato mozzarella caprese and broccoli (under 500 calories!) and then a brownie obsession to mess it all up. I only wish they had more fish platters and a wider variety of desserts!

As long as Brittni is my bar tender, this will always be the location I will visit. She by far has the best customer service than I have received at any location. We have a location close to home but not the service she provides.

So....Fridays is Fridays. But if youcome to this one, sit at the bar. Ask for Brittni or Scott. These two will make sure that your experiebce is top par and appreciated. I can go to any fridays in the area, but i will drive an additional 3 miles out of the way to make sure my experience is the best. Great people, management CARES ABOUT YOUR EXPERIENCE, and they know how to make great cocktails :) trust me. Im picky lol

Really bad customer service. Showed up on 11/04, around 830pm on a Friday, even though the place was empty the waitress said there is a wait time of 20min and in general seemed very disinterested.  Finally waiting for 10min to see why we could not be seated when there were so many empty spots we just decided to leave and go to Royal Taj! Now there is a place that knows how to treat is customers well something the management of this place can learn.

Worst place to go eat. Customer service is so bad. I will never go there again. That's all I am going to say. Stay away from here. Don't waste your $. U can go to McDonald's and get better customer service. Or maybe same. It's ridiculous

worst service I'd ever seen I'm my life I asked 10 times no to put cheese because I am allergic and still they put cheese and if that's not enough the young lady that is supposed to be the hostess very rude unpleasant and plain and simple just no nice! don't eat here it's better to stay hungry!

Some of my friends and I decided to try this place after spending most of the time in the library studying for the exams. We were lucky to find out about the unlimited appetizers for dinner. So we decided to try them out. They have limited variety of appetizer in the appetizer section for the unlimited appetizer deal. So it was kinda disappointing. Never the less, we tried almost all of them, I guess it was about 6 to 7 different appetizer. Our favorite one was flat bread pizza. It was so delicious , we literally ordered it at least 3 more times. Most disappointing was the pork pot sticker. I love pork, so I was really looking forward to trying out their pork stickers but it did not live up to it's standards. Hence, I had to chastise them for this reason.  However, it's a great place to hangout with friends and catch up on some old memories.

Very poor customer service. Went in about 6 o'clock on Saturday 1/21/2016. There were lots of open tables. We had a party of 4 and we ask for the wait time and the hostess said 30-45 mins wait. This seem like a crazy long time for all the empty seats. We said we would just go somewhere else and the hostess said "WONDERFUL" . I love Friday's but it's safe to say we will not be returning to this WONDERFUL location Ever!

I usually avoid chain restaurants as they are a decent amount of fast casual options in the area for lunch. I've been to this Fridays before and it was ok. The food was edible and service just ok. Today's experience was five star worthy and unfortunately I was too busy having a chat w coworkers to get his name but the waiter was awesome. It was about two or three other groups of customers there at the time so the one waiter was working the entire bar area. He had us all sign up for the rewards program and bought our apps for us, so we still get to use our coupon for joining next time and he got a nice tip for saving us some cash, win win. I don't plan to come back any time soon but the deal was worth it, and this time the food was actually good

Definitely a hit or miss.  Came here after my sons football game and we already knew what we wanted. The table ordered a cheese burger, cajun chicken and shrimp pasta and Jack Daniels chicken sandwich. Everything that could be wrong with the food was wrong. The burger was burnt and dry, chicken was dry and bread was hard and the pasta... was just nasty. No other way to put it. We expressed out disgust to our server, who in turn went to get the manager on duty Kareem. We told him how the food was and he cleared the table and offered to redo the food. Everyone got the same thing except me, I went for the fried shrimp and fries.  After the second try the food was decent.  Im giving one start for the food and a other star just because the manager handled the situation appropriately.

We ended up here because Royal Taj and Olive Garden were overflowing with customers.  (The wait at Royal Taj was 75 minutes.)  We were surprised when we walked into this Friday's at the height of lunch time with the majority of tables empty.  Our initial impression was not great.  There were two greeters who seemed disinterested.  They barely looked up at us.  One greeter told the other greeter a table number.  We got a "follow me" and then a "your server will be here shortly."  (That wait wasn't so short.) There was a slight odor about the place, as if the floors had been mopped with dirty water.  There was a "dated" vibe.  My wife commented that the place certainly wasn't "happening." Our server was very polite, but oddly, the service was slow.  We saw another server running back and forth between tables and kitchen, but our server disappeared after the order was taken.  Our drinks arrived just one or two minutes before the food.  Again, the server was polite, and she checked on us a few times, but there were several more long waits following requests. That said, the food was a plus.  I found the black bean burger to be well-topped with condiments and cheese, and the fries came out relatively hot.  My wife liked her salad, and our kids liked their kids meals.  Portion size was adequate but not impressive. I wouldn't be opposed to eating here again, but with so many restaurants in Columbia that are excelling in service and ambiance, it is unlikely that we will be back to this location anytime soon.

Talk about terrible service! My waiter was unable to remember any of the orders we requested. Often times we checked the status of my order and he would say he forgot to put the order in. We waited over an hour both times when we ordered food. In fact, it took over an hour to make a chicken Cobb salad! This is ridiculous. Someone please train the employees of the Columbia TGIF.

Went for a quick burger and fries night with my family.  Parking lot wasn't crowded so I figured we would be in and out in no time. Went in and maybe 3 tables were being served in the dining area and the bar side was full. The hostess told us it would be a 20-30 wait for the dining room. We were thinking ...for what it's empty! However we decided to go ahead and wait. After about 15 minutes we noticed they must have been short staffed that night 2-20-2017. We knew it would take forever to get seated, put orders in AND have food delivered. So we decided to leave. We went to Famous Dave's and walked right in and placed orders. Food was available in no time. Never again will I visit TGIFridays at this location!
ROACHES!!!!! Went on 2/18/2017 and service was slow. Took almost an hour to get entrees and drinks refilled. After we finished our food a ROACH came crawling across the table.

Very dirty, sat us at a dirty table and then had the nerve to ask what was wrong. Bathroom was filthy with tissues all over the floor accompanied by the foul odor of BM. I didn't get a chance to order because I was never moved to a clean table & the host was unbothered, I will never go back to this restaurant again!

Dirty and slow service. I won't be going back to this location. We ordered water and soda for drinks and our appetizers came out WAY before the drinks. When I inquired about the drinks, I was told they were "being made" at the bar. I told them it was water. The surrounding tables had dishes stacked and not been cleaned the entire time we were there. The "endless apps" left our stomachs in endless pain. Greasy and poor quality. And, to top it off, the bathrooms had sticky floors. Here's a tip: for the "suggested tip" at the bottom of your receipt- do the math yourself. They falsify the numbers. The apps are $10 on the menu. Period. Yet, on the receipt, they add and then subtract but expect you to tip on multiple orders when it is clearly labeled on the menu as one order.

Friday's has had so many ups and downs, often you will hear the term... "hit or miss". But every since they brought back endless apps, there has been no miss! $10 for endless appetizers and you can't go wrong with that! My favorite is definitely the flat bread but I still end up enjoying some mozzarella sticks and fried pickles. Also, if you tell them your a Stripes member you get free chips and salsa! As far as the entree I will ALWAYS recommend the Cajun Shrimp Pasta and dessert the Brownie Obsession or the Vanilla Bean Cake can never go wrong. The host Amayjah was extremely pleasant and had great customer service, way to go Fridays, you are finally working your way back into the heart of customers!  To all----I recommend that you become a Stripes member and start scanning your Stripe codes!

I am completely disgusted about my visit to Fridays this evening. My friend and I arrived and sat at the bar around 1230am. We were walked by several times by two bartenders, one male amd one female, and was never acknowledged. I attempted to ask the bartender for service, after walking past me for the 5th time but I was ignored. I watched the female bartender walk around, asking if everyone was okay, glanced, then intentionally skipped us. She approached the table beside us and the patrons sitting at the bar across from us, then quickly went back around the bar. The male was engaged in a friendly convo with a group dining nearby. I eventually got up and went to the bar for service and was told the kitchen was closed. I called an hr earlier to verify the kitchen closed at 1am. I dine here at least once a wk. I will not be returning. Extremely disappointed.

Soooo...I'm sitting here at the bar at Fridays on a Saturday night. I should mention that I don't come here for the food. Anywho, the bartender is awesome and I'm enjoying my Strawberry Henny, immensely...Then I see something I wish I hadn't...A waitress picking up a drink for a table does the unthinkable...she puts a straw in and takes a sip...OF SOMEONE'S DRINK!! I kid you not!! I promise you that I'm not drunk...and I've got a witness. I would have rated this visit at least 4 stars...but you get the picture. #that'snasty

Service wasn't ok for first visit , the steak came cold , mash potatoes cold . I will give them another chance soon hopefully will be better . 3 stars it's fair hopefully I will change it next visit to 5 stars .

Nice place and ambiance, food is so so, service is bad - the 2 stars is for our server who worked like slave....still smiling and apologetic. Food wait time is almost an hour for a burger!!!! Entree was served before the appetizers. Will never recommend and comeback.

One of the worst restaurant experiences I've had. They had to remake a salad three times because they typed it wrong, then added chicken, then added salmon, all to a plain salad order. Our medium rare steak came out more than well done, and we watched them ask down tables trying to find ours with the food. Our food was served one at a time across 45 minutes after ordering, to 1:15 bringing one every ten minutes or so for a party of 5.

The lady at the front with the bush is so annoying. On two separate occasions I asked for something from her, she said she'd be right back & never came back. I think she does it on purpose. Anyway they were giving soda out of two liters & the soda was flat but do what you gotta do. Our waiter which we've had twice before was really nice! & both managers made sure we were okay. The food was good & it came out in a timely manner. But If that lady wasn't so annoying I would have 5 stared them.

Tried to come here on a Friday night and will never come back again. We were told it would be a 15min wait, even though there was a lot of open tables. We ended up waiting about 45mins until we got a table. After being seated, we were not acknowledged by any wait staff. We waited another 10mins and then decided that we wasted enough of our time here. There's so many other good restaurants around, pick another!

I stay at the motel next door monthly and have for the past 19 months.    I hope each time the service gets better.  It never does.    This place SUCKS.       I have dined in the bar area and the restaurant.   They all are  poor.     Food arrives cold.   No one wants to help with water or a beer.        The manager of this location needs to go work at McDonald's.   Poor place

Let's see where to start. Had to wait to be seated. After waiting for 10 minutes we went to the bar. That should have been my first sign to leave. But hey we were hungry and in the area. Order our apps then that took forever. Then our food came out HORRIBLE HORRIBLE.  THERE NO OTHER WAY TO SAY IT. ordered the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta with salmon added. Salmon was dry and no taste plus burned. Second guest ordered Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp with extra shrimp.  Shrimp were burned.  Waiter got the manger which 3 people had to call over. Where the customer service

Went for dinner. Sat and waited 20 minutes for someone to wait on us (at a table straight across from the hostess). Waitress visited the table next to us at least twice.  When we got up to leave, the waitress looked at us as if to say "where are you going?". We would frequent here often in the past. Now I understand why the parking lot is so empty, especially on a Friday nite.  This place used to be hopping! We will NEVER go back. If I could give this place a ZERO, I would.  Don't waist your time.  The neighboring Olive Garden was a much better option!

10 years ago when we first moved to this area, this Friday's was like most and would have been jammed on a weekend night.  This Friday night, parking lot was half empty.  Oh, how the mighty have fallen.  Our party of 5 was seated and we waited 20 minutes for our waitress to appear.  Nope - never happened.  The waitress who was serving the people next to us looked at us several times but never offered to take a drink order at least, let us know that our server would be there shortly (or she may have been our server?) or anything.  We got up and left.  Many moons ago I proudly worked for TGI Friday's after college.  That crap would have never been allowed to happen.  They been going downhill for a while but this ensured I'm never going back.

I have never had a sit down meal at this location but I have ordered take out twice and each time the order was incomplete or wrong and I waited over an hour for them to find my food. If you can't even get a take out order right, I'm not going to bother sitting down for a meal at this restaurant. And how I wait for hour for cold food. I had to remind them of 3 to 4 items missing from the order. Management could care less about my complaint or the fact that I waited for over an hour. He just looked and me and gave an apology that was about as offensive as that cold food. Don't go here until they have a complete overhaul of management. It's a waste of your time and money.
Not bad but not so good ... I did like my sizzering chicken and chesse , my boyfriend likes jack daniel sauce so much. it was took a bit times till they seated us to table . Service was so so.
Pretty good location,good food, friendly waitress. Tasty meal. We were a group the waitress did a good job and n servicing all of us in a timely manner. Not bad for lunch time on a Friday.

The place is empty and the service is terrible. I sit at the bar. I am one of three people in the bar area and it still took the bar tender 11 mins to get to me. Typically I visit after 5 but today it was before 4. Now I remember why I only visit when certain people are behind the bar. The food was standard. Taste like it always does.
Good food and service.  Came on a Wednesday evening, no problem finding a table for two.
Second time here in a few months. We were hoping for a better time but NOPE. Service was super slow for a pretty empty place. Good was at best meh.
Slow service. Waited 45 minutes for quick wings at the bar and they never came. Finally got ip and left.

I wish that I could give this location zero stars, the customer service was beyond poor and the manager Rob was very unprofessional!!! First issue was when I called to make my order I was placed on hold for 5 minutes so the host could go find a server to take my order, other establishments have the host take your order for you. There was absolutely no reason to have me on hold because they weren't busy I was sitting outside of the restaurant in my car!! So I go in to pick up my food, the host and the young lady that was at the host stand their conversation was more important then greeting me!!!! I tell them the name for my order and I also ask for a manager too because the TGIF app is giving me an error code that says ask my server for help. The manager Rob walks over to me and says "your looking for me"? That is not how the manger of a restaurant should address a guest!!!! I begin to tell Rob about the issue that I'm having when the server that took my order (Owen) walks up puts my order down and starts chit chatting with the host plus the other girl that was at the host stand. Rob tells me that there isn't much that he can really do, maybe I should try and log in from TGIF website instead of the app. I try to log in from the website and I got an error code from them as well, I show it to Rob and he says that he can't do anything without a code to redeem. Then he tells me to call TGIF 800 number, now the three employees that are at the host stand whispering back and forth about me like I can't see or hear them!!!! I call the 800 number only to be redirected back to the website to resolve my issue, I put my phone on speaker so Rob can hear it and he tells me that he can't do anything!!!!! Now the three employees at the host stand are trying to decide on which one of them are getting the food because I wasn't!!!! Only after telling Rob that I was calling corporate about this was he more sympathetic but still unwilling to help me figure this out!!! I spend hundreds of dollars at this restaurant every month and this is why I have these rewards points but after tonight they can have their reward points because I will NEVER spend another dollar at TGIF!!! I suggest that you don't either!!!!

Ok keep in mind this ain't fine dining, however I've never been so f'n grossed out by a bartender in my life. I would expect a male bartender to be slightly unsanitary but I've seen stray dogs in a trailer park with more cleanliness then the lady who couldn't get me a water with lemon on the side. She argued me down and told me that I asked her to squeeze 2 lemons in my water  (where they do that at?) Then I watched her scratch the bare skin on her belly and her back while she took our order. It was bad enough that her belly was even showing but even worst that she chewed on her finger nails every time she needed to think about something . She finally wanted to bring my lemon on the side so she went to kitchen and brought out a bare fist full of lemon like she was in her personal kitchen and tried to put it in a cup and bring it to the table"GIRL I SEE YOU! Take it back!!" Then she slammed the water down on the counter. I complained to the manager and a new server (Tasha, she works weekends ONLY ask for her) helped us out and she was great in giving her best effort in reviving the terrible experience me and my wife had. Shout out to you! But all in all, stay the hell outta the bar at fridays in Columbia. Tasha got them 2 stars woulda been no stars
7:30 pm on a weekday, not busy at all. Took 10 min to get our orders in and over 10 min until we finally get our drinks (cola). 20 min later for the food that was cold.

Recently gave this place another try and all I can say is wow!!! Huge difference, my waiter was engaged and personable, food was fast and picture perfect and met the new general manager. She seemed very sincere and really involved with the staff. We will be back soon and look forward to seeing more positivity since the manager said she just transferred to this location. Thumbs up fridays! Now if you had a sign showing people you are all the way back there it would be even better!

TGIFaildays Can't comment much beyond my family and I sat in a half full restaurant for 15 minutes and were not even acknowledged. Mentioned to the hostess on our way out that no one ever came to our table... no reaction at all to my complaint. AVOID AT ALL COST.

I've been coming here for years and today is the last time I come here! The service is horrible, they charged us for two extra drinks and didn't even want to take it off. The server was extremely disrespectful her name is cat. She told us she was going to get the manager and the manger Corey wasn't helpful. Never coming here again such a disappointment.
